result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on January 24, 2023 at 01:30 pm.
and Motion to Reset Hearing
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 1, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Approved s/CAH
Letter to Judge - Reschedule

11:37 AM Prosecuting attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Cole Thomas Southworth appeared by video.  Attorney John Miller Carroll appeared by video for Cole Thomas Southworth. 
Court notes that a letter was received in July from Atty Carroll asking for a new date stating treatment would not be available until September 15th.  Atty Carroll states that the assessments are at a back log due to COVID; requests the matter be reset.  Atty Juech states that it is not included in an offer but has no objection to the reset.  Atty Carroll asks for an October date.

BY THE COURT:  Court will reset based on the request.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 17, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 15, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Approved/ call to reset
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 18, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Atty Burdon filed the information electronically with the Court.  Atty Carroll will proceed with the arraignment without the information in hand. Court advises defendant of maximum penalties.  Defendant understands. 

Atty Carroll enters a Not Guilty plea.

BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant. 
bond continued

9:16 AM Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Cole Thomas Southworth appeared by video.  Attorney John Miller Carroll appeared by video for Cole Thomas Southworth. 
Court questions the defendant regarding in-person appearance.  Defendant waives their in-person appearance today & will proceed by zoom. 

Atty Carroll states that the defendant will be waiving the Prelim today and has discussed the waiver with his client.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees with the waiver.  Court accepts the waiver of the Prelim.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings.
Status hearing scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 11:45 am.
Status hearing on June 7, 2022 at 11:45 am.
and Questionaire

10:49 AM Defendant Cole Thomas Southworth appeared by video.  Attorney John Miller Carroll appeared by video for Cole Thomas Southworth.  Attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Carroll states that he and the Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading. Atty Carroll received an offer from the State and wants to waive the Prelim.
Court advises defendant of maximum penalties.  Defendant understands. 
Atty Carroll waives the time limits for the Prelim.  

BY THE COURT:  Defendant waives time limits for the preliminary hearing. 
bond continued
Waiver of Prelim scheduled for May 10, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Waiver of Prelim on May 10, 2022 at 09:15 am.

03:28 PM Defendant Cole Thomas Southworth appeared by video means from Marquette County Jail. Attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video means for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.    Court confirms address and phone.    Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant understands and has contacted an Attorney.

  Atty Juech has no objection to a signature bond with conditions.

BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $1,00 Signature bond with conditions:
*No use or possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription  Initial appearance scheduled for March 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.
